intro: Cleistes cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has a short flowering period, usually in the spring, and is known for its unique, fragrant blooms. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
